alert.note: Alert for Bland; Giles; Pulaski; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 5:35PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Bland, Giles, Pulaski and Wythe. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 535 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Crab Orchard Creek, Bentley Branch, Little Pine Run, Altoona Branch, Back Creek, Goose Creek, Brown Lick Branch, East Wilderness Creek, Hunting Camp Creek, Dismal Creek, Helveys Mill Creek, Little Walker Creek, Kimberling Creek, Cove Creek and East Fork Indian Grave Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pulaski... Long Spur... Mechanicsburg... Gunton Park... White Gate... Kimberling... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
